page.title: 16 BIRDLIFE OF PRESTATYN
page.content:
Gorse and scrub areas provide a habitat for Yellowhammers,Goldfinches, Chaffinches,Greenfinches,Linnets, Magpies,Blackbirds,Song Thrushes, Robins and Woodcocks and, in Summer, Common and Lesser Whitethroats.
Farmland residents include the Kestrel,Little Owl,Carrion Crow,Rook, Skylark,Meadow Pipit and Lapwing.
The large area of gardens in Prestatyn attracts many birds including many tits,finches and thrushes as well as Starlings,House Sparrows,Jackdaws and Collared Doves. In cold weather large numbers of birds move from the surrounding countryside to feed on bird tables.
